intro: Sebastiania corniculata var. hassleriana, commonly known as the red-leafed sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions with warm, humid climates. The plant is characterized by its striking, glossy red leaves that contrast with its small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. This variety is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant foliage.
